alert.note: Alert for Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 20 at 1:33PM MST until December 22 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, locally up to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph, up to 80 mph exposed ridgelines. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from midnight tonight to 4 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM Wednesday to 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. Areas of blowing and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
